name: Moonblade
purpose: A Moonblade serves as a guardian of elf culture and heritage. It seeks a worthy wielder of elf blood to champion the elf people.
personality: The Moonblade has the accumulated personalities of all its previous wielders. It is patient, wise, and deeply invested in the long-term welfare of elvenkind. It communicates through emotional impressions and brief telepathic images rather than words. The blade judges its wielder's actions against the high standards set by previous owners.
attunementRequirements: Attuned by an elf or half-elf of neutral good alignment. If a non-elf or unworthy creature attempts to attune, they take 2d6 necrotic damage and the attempt fails.
properties: Rune Blade: A Moonblade gains one rune for each wielder who has attuned to it. The DM chooses or randomly determines each rune's property.
+1 Weapon: The Moonblade has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for its first rune.
Additional Runes (d6): 1 - Extra +1 (total +2), 2 - Crits on 19-20, 3 - 1d6 extra fire damage on hit, 4 - Wielder gains Darkvision 60 ft., 5 - Cast Fly on self 1/day, 6 - Resurrect wielder 1/week.
Sentient: The blade can communicate telepathically with its wielder and convey emotions when within 120 feet.
conflictBehavior: If the wielder acts against the interests of elvenkind, the Moonblade attempts to suppress its rune abilities. Persistent betrayal causes the blade to refuse to function, becoming a mundane longsword until the wielder atones.
